intro: Marlea unilocularis, commonly known as the one-chambered marlea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers that are typically yellow or orange in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing on rocky soils. Marlea unilocularis is adapted to withstand drought conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
